member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.BannouConnectionManager
member.summary: Manages the WebSocket connection to Bannou services with auto-reconnect, health checks, and event routing.
member.remarks: This class wraps BannouClient and provides: - Automatic reconnection with exponential backoff - Health check loop for connection monitoring - Event subscription/dispatch pattern - Connection status tracking with events

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.IClientCutsceneHandler
member.summary: Client-side cutscene handler for game engine integration.

remarks.para: Implement this interface in your game engine to receive cutscene commands from the behavior system and translate them into game actions.
The typical flow is:

list.item: - Take control of entities, disable player input
- Execute choreographed actions (walk_to, attack, look_at)
- Report when local entity reaches sync point
- Resume execution when server releases sync
- Return control, re-enable player input

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.IClientCutsceneHandler.OnCutsceneStartAsync(System.String,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyList{System.Guid},System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Called when a cutscene begins.
member.remarks:
The game engine should:
Disable player input for controlled entities
Prepare visual elements (letterbox, UI hide)
Store current entity states for potential skip-to-end

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.IClientCutsceneHandler.OnCutsceneEndAsync(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Called when a cutscene ends.
member.remarks:
The game engine should:
Re-enable player input for controlled entities
Remove visual elements (letterbox, etc.)
Sync final entity states if necessary
member.param: Whether the cutscene was aborted (vs completed normally).

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.IClientCutsceneHandler.ExecuteActionAsync(System.Guid,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyDictionary{System.String,System.Object},System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Executes a cinematic action on an entity.

remarks.para: Common actions include:

list.item: walk_to - Move entity to position/mark
attack - Execute attack animation
look_at - Face toward target
play_animation - Play specific animation clip
emote - Display emotion/expression
speak - Show dialogue/speech

remarks.para: The game engine is responsible for interpreting action names and parameters according to its own animation/movement systems.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.IClientCutsceneHandler.OnSyncPointReachedAsync(System.String,System.Guid,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Called when a local entity reaches a sync point.
member.remarks: The game engine should pause execution for this entity until is called for this sync point.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.IClientCutsceneHandler.OnSyncPointReleasedAsync(System.String,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Called when server releases a sync point (all participants reached).
member.remarks: All entities waiting at this sync point should resume execution.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.IClientCutsceneHandler.ExecuteCameraActionAsync(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyDictionary{System.String,System.Object},System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Called when a camera action is requested.
member.remarks:
Camera actions are separate from entity actions and typically include:
move_to - Move camera to position
track - Follow/track an entity
shake - Apply camera shake effect
zoom - Zoom in/out
cut_to - Instant camera cut

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.IClientInputHandler
member.summary: Client-side input handler for QTEs and player choices.

remarks.para: Implement this interface in your game engine to display input prompts and collect player input during cutscenes and dialogues.
The "blue/red/gray box" mental model:

list.item: Blue box: Your turn to input (local player is target)
Red box: Their turn (waiting for another player)
Gray box: No input allowed (cinematic in progress)

remarks.para: All input is server-adjudicated - player input is a "suggestion" that may be accepted, modified, or replaced by timeout defaults.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.IClientInputHandler.OnInputWindowOpened(BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.ClientInputWindow,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Called when an input window opens.

remarks.para: The parameter determines the box color:

list.item: true = Blue box (player should provide input)
false = Red box (waiting for another player)

remarks.para: The game engine should display appropriate UI based on window type and start any timeout timers.

member.param: True if this player should provide input.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.IClientInputHandler.OnInputWindowClosed(System.String,BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.ClientInputResult)
member.summary: Called when an input window closes.
member.remarks: The game engine should hide the input UI and may display feedback based on the result (success, timeout, rejected).

member.summary: Called to update the remaining time on an input window.

member.summary: Submits player input for an active window.
member.remarks: This method sends input to the server for adjudication. The server may accept, reject, or modify the input.

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.IControlGate
member.summary: Controls which system writes to entity intent channels.

remarks.para: The control gate determines the priority of different input sources:

list.item: Cinematic (highest) - Forced, takes full control
Player - Direct player commands
Opportunity - Optional, becomes cinematic if accepted
Behavior (lowest) - Autonomous AI behavior stack

remarks.para: During cinematics, the behavior stack continues evaluating (for QTE defaults) but its outputs are masked and not applied to entities.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.IControlGate.GetControlMode(System.Guid)
member.summary: Gets the current control mode for an entity.
member.returns: The current control mode.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.IControlGate.TakeCinematicControl(System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyList{System.Guid},System.String)
member.summary: Takes cinematic control of entities.
member.remarks:
While under cinematic control:
Behavior stack continues evaluating (for QTE defaults)
Behavior outputs are masked (not sent to entities)
Player input is disabled (except for QTEs)
Cinematic commands are sent directly to entities

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.IControlGate.ReturnControl(System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyList{System.Guid})
member.summary: Returns control to normal behavior for entities.

remarks.para: When control is returned:

list.item: Behavior stack outputs are unmasked
Player input is re-enabled
Entity state may need sync (see handoff options)

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.IControlGate.GetSessionId(System.Guid)
member.summary: Gets the session ID for an entity under cinematic control.
member.returns: The session ID, or null if not under cinematic control.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.IControlGate.GetEntitiesInSession(System.String)
member.summary: Gets all entities currently in a cutscene session.
member.returns: Entities in the session.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.IControlGate.GetBehaviorDefault(System.Guid)
member.summary: Gets the behavior stack's computed output for an entity.

remarks.para: This returns what the behavior stack WOULD output if it had control. Useful for QTE defaults where the character agent computes "what I would do."
Returns null if the entity has no active behavior stack.

member.returns: The behavior stack's computed intent, or null.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.IControlGate.IsPlayerInputAllowed(System.Guid)
member.summary: Checks if an entity is currently accepting player input.
member.returns: True if player input is accepted.

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.BehaviorModelCache
member.summary: Caches behavior model interpreters per (character, type, variant) combination. Supports fallback chains for variant selection.

remarks.para: Models are registered by type and variant name (e.g., "sword-and-shield" combat). When requesting an interpreter, the cache checks the fallback chain to find the best available variant.
Example fallback chain for combat: ["sword-and-shield", "one-handed", "default"] If character requests "sword-and-shield" and it's not registered, falls back to "one-handed", then "default".
Thread-safety: The cache uses ConcurrentDictionary for thread-safe access. Individual interpreter instances are NOT thread-safe - each character should have its own interpreter.

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.BehaviorModelCache.DefaultVariant
member.summary: Default variant name used when no variant is specified.

member.summary: Unregisters a behavior model.
member.returns: True if the model was removed, false if not found.

member.param: Ordered list of variant names to try.

remarks.para: Example: SetFallbackChain(Combat, ["sword-and-shield", "one-handed", "default"])
When GetInterpreter is called with variant "sword-and-shield" but it's not registered, the cache will try "one-handed", then "default".

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.IBehaviorEvaluator
member.summary: Interface for evaluating behavior models per character. Game implements this to integrate with its entity/component system.

remarks.para: The SDK provides IntentMerger and BehaviorEvaluatorBase, but the game is responsible for: - Managing which models are active per character - Providing the shared input state (game state) - Applying the MergedIntent to animations/physics - Calling EvaluateCharacter each frame

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.IBehaviorEvaluator.EvaluateCharacter(System.Guid,System.ReadOnlySpan{System.Double})
member.summary: Evaluates all active behavior models for a character and returns the merged intent.
member.param: Current game state as input values.
member.returns: Merged intent from all active behavior models.

remarks.para: The sharedInputState contains values like: - Character health, stamina, position - Nearby enemy positions and states - Current equipped items - Environment conditions
All 4 model types (combat, movement, interaction, idle) are evaluated if active, then merged using urgency-based resolution.

member.param: The behavior model type to invalidate.

remarks.para: Call this when: - Character equips new weapon (combat model may change) - Character's class changes (all models may change) - Model is hot-reloaded during development

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.IBehaviorEvaluator.InvalidateAllModels(System.Guid)
member.summary: Invalidates all cached models for a character.
member.remarks: Call this when a character is respawned or their configuration changes significantly.

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Intent.AttentionIntent
member.summary: Attention intent with blendable gaze targets.

remarks.para: Unlike simple exclusive channels, attention supports "blending" by providing multiple targets with weights. The game's animation system can then interpolate gaze direction between targets based on their weights.

Since entity IDs (Guids) cannot be mathematically blended, this struct provides primary and secondary targets with urgency-derived weights. The game resolves entity positions and performs actual gaze interpolation.
Example: Combat model wants to watch the threat (urgency 0.8), Movement model wants to look at the path ahead (urgency 0.4). Game blends gaze 67% toward threat, 33% toward path.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Intent.AttentionIntent.PrimaryTarget
member.summary: Primary attention target entity (highest urgency contributor). Null if no attention targets.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Intent.AttentionIntent.PrimaryUrgency
member.summary: Urgency of the primary attention target [0.0 - 1.0].

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Intent.AttentionIntent.SecondaryTarget
member.summary: Secondary attention target entity (second-highest urgency contributor). Null if only one model contributed attention.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Intent.AttentionIntent.SecondaryUrgency
member.summary: Urgency of the secondary attention target [0.0 - 1.0].

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Intent.AttentionIntent.BlendWeight
member.summary: Blend weight for primary target [0.0 - 1.0]. The game should blend gaze: BlendWeight toward primary, (1-BlendWeight) toward secondary. If no secondary target, this will be 1.0.
member.remarks: Calculated as: PrimaryUrgency / (PrimaryUrgency + SecondaryUrgency)

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Intent.AttentionIntent.TotalUrgency
member.summary: Combined urgency for animation transition speed.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Intent.AttentionIntent.None
member.summary: Empty attention intent (not looking at anything specific).

member.summary: Whether this intent has a valid attention target.

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Intent.BehaviorOutput
member.summary: Structured output from a single behavior model evaluation. Extracted from raw output buffer based on IntentSlotLayout conventions.

remarks.para: Each behavior model (combat, movement, interaction, idle) produces one BehaviorOutput. The IntentMerger combines these into a single MergedIntent.

Output extraction uses the standardized slot layout: - Slots 0-1: Action intent + urgency - Slots 2-3: Locomotion intent + urgency - Slots 4-5: Attention target + urgency - Slots 6-7: Stance intent + urgency - Slots 8-9: Vocalization intent + urgency - Slots 10-12: Locomotion target Vector3 (optional) - Slot 13: Action target entity ID (optional) - Slot 14: Attention target entity ID (optional)

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Intent.BehaviorOutput.ActionIntent

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Intent.BehaviorOutput.ActionUrgency
member.summary: Action channel urgency [0.0 - 1.0]. Higher urgency wins in conflict resolution.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Intent.BehaviorOutput.ActionTarget
member.summary: Target entity for the action (e.g., attack target, item to pick up). Null if action doesn't require a target.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Intent.BehaviorOutput.LocomotionIntent

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Intent.BehaviorOutput.LocomotionUrgency
member.summary: Locomotion channel urgency [0.0 - 1.0]. Used for blending when multiple models contribute locomotion.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Intent.BehaviorOutput.LocomotionTarget

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Intent.BehaviorOutput.AttentionTarget

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Intent.BehaviorOutput.AttentionUrgency

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Intent.BehaviorModelType
member.summary: The fixed set of behavior model types for multi-model coordination. Each character can have up to 4 simultaneously-active behavior models.

remarks.para: These are intentionally fixed (not configurable) for simplicity. The IntentMerger knows how to blend outputs from these 4 model types.

Mapping to IntentChannels: - Any model can emit to any channel - Combat typically emits to Action, Stance - Movement emits to Locomotion - Interaction emits to Action, Attention - Idle emits to all channels with low urgency

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Intent.BehaviorModelType.Combat
member.summary: Attack, defend, combo management.

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Intent.BehaviorModelType.Movement
member.summary: Navigation, pathfinding, steering.

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Intent.BehaviorModelType.Interaction
member.summary: Item use, dialogue, environment interaction.

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Intent.BehaviorModelType.Idle
member.summary: Ambient behavior, waiting, breathing.

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Intent.IntentSlotLayout
member.summary: Output slot layout convention for EmitIntent opcode. Each intent channel uses 2 consecutive output slots: [action_index, urgency].

remarks.para:
Output buffer layout (10 slots minimum):
[0] Action intent (string table index) [1] Action urgency (0.0 - 1.0) [2] Locomotion intent (string table index) [3] Locomotion urgency (0.0 - 1.0) [4] Attention target (entity ID or 0) [5] Attention urgency (0.0 - 1.0) [6] Stance intent (string table index) [7] Stance urgency (0.0 - 1.0) [8] Vocalization intent (string table index) [9] Vocalization urgency (0.0 - 1.0)
Extended slots (10+) can be used for: - Locomotion target position (Vector3: slots 10-12) - Action target entity (slot 13) - Additional channel-specific data

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Intent.IntentSlotLayout.SlotsPerChannel
member.summary: Number of output slots per intent channel (intent + urgency).

member.summary: Total number of channels (Action, Locomotion, Attention, Stance, Vocalization).

member.summary: Minimum required output buffer size for all intent channels.

member.summary: Slot index for locomotion target X coordinate.

member.summary: Slot index for locomotion target Y coordinate.

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Intent.IntentMerger
member.summary: Merges behavior outputs from multiple models using urgency-based resolution.

remarks.para: Each character can have up to 4 simultaneously-active behavior models. The IntentMerger resolves which model's output wins for each channel.

Resolution strategies: - Exclusive channels (Action, Stance, Vocalization): Highest urgency wins - Blendable channels (Locomotion): Weighted blend by urgency - Attention: Blendable (outputs primary/secondary targets with weights for gaze interpolation)
Zero-urgency outputs are ignored (model didn't emit for that channel).

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Intent.IntentMerger.UrgencyThreshold
member.summary: Minimum urgency threshold. Outputs below this are treated as zero.
Merge outputs from all active behavior models into a single MergedIntent.
member.param: Output from combat behavior model (may be null).
Output from movement behavior model (may be null).
Output from interaction behavior model (may be null).
Output from idle behavior model (may be null).
member.returns: Merged intent for game engine consumption.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Intent.IntentMerger.SelectExclusiveAction(System.ValueTuple{System.Nullable{BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Intent.BehaviorOutput},BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Intent.BehaviorModelType}[])
member.summary: Selects the action with highest urgency.

member.summary: Blends locomotion from all contributors weighted by urgency.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Intent.IntentMerger.BlendAttention(System.ValueTuple{System.Nullable{BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Intent.BehaviorOutput},BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Intent.BehaviorModelType}[])
member.summary: Blends attention from all contributors, outputting primary and secondary targets with weights.
member.remarks: Entity IDs (Guids) cannot be mathematically blended, so we output the top two contributors with their urgency-derived weights. The game resolves entity positions and performs actual gaze interpolation.

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Intent.LocomotionIntent
member.summary: Locomotion intent with blendable target position.

remarks.para: Unlike other intent channels which are exclusive (highest urgency wins), locomotion can blend multiple contributors weighted by urgency.
Example: Combat model wants to strafe left (urgency 0.8), Movement model wants to walk forward (urgency 0.4). Result: diagonal movement weighted toward strafing.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Intent.LocomotionIntent.Intent
member.summary: Movement intent name (e.g., "walk_to", "run_away", "strafe", "dodge"). Null if no locomotion intent.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Intent.LocomotionIntent.Target
member.summary: Blended target position in world space. Null if the intent doesn't specify a target (e.g., "stop", "idle").

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Intent.LocomotionIntent.Speed
member.summary: Normalized movement speed multiplier [0.0 - 1.0]. 0.0 = stationary, 1.0 = maximum speed for this intent.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Intent.LocomotionIntent.Urgency
member.summary: Combined urgency of all contributing locomotion intents. Used by animation system to determine transition speed.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Intent.LocomotionIntent.None
member.summary: Empty locomotion intent (no movement).

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Intent.LocomotionIntent.IsValid
member.summary: Whether this intent represents valid locomotion data.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Intent.LocomotionIntent.Create(System.String,System.Numerics.Vector3,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Creates a locomotion intent with target position.
member.returns: A new LocomotionIntent instance.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Intent.LocomotionIntent.CreateWithoutTarget(System.String,System.Single)
member.summary: Creates a locomotion intent without target (for intents like "stop", "idle").
member.returns: A new LocomotionIntent instance.

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Intent.MergedIntent
member.summary: The merged result of all behavior model outputs. This is what the game engine acts on each frame.

remarks.para: MergedIntent represents the final decision after the IntentMerger resolves conflicts between multiple simultaneously-active behavior models.

Resolution rules: - Action: Exclusive (highest urgency wins) - Locomotion: Blendable (targets weighted by urgency) - Attention: Blendable (multiple targets with weights for gaze interpolation) - Stance: Exclusive (highest urgency wins) - Vocalization: Exclusive (highest urgency wins)

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Intent.MergedIntent.Action
member.summary: Winning action intent from highest-urgency contributor. Null if no model emitted an action.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Intent.MergedIntent.ActionTarget
member.summary: Target entity for the winning action. Null if the action doesn't require a target.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Intent.MergedIntent.ActionUrgency
member.summary: Urgency of the winning action [0.0 - 1.0]. Useful for animation blending speed.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Intent.MergedIntent.Locomotion
member.summary: Blended locomotion intent from all contributors.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Intent.MergedIntent.Attention
member.summary: Blended attention intent from all contributors. Contains primary and secondary targets with weights for gaze interpolation.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Intent.MergedIntent.Stance
member.summary: Winning stance intent from highest-urgency contributor. Null if no model emitted a stance.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Intent.MergedIntent.StanceUrgency
member.summary: Urgency of the winning stance [0.0 - 1.0].

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Intent.MergedIntent.Vocalization
member.summary: Winning vocalization intent from highest-urgency contributor. Null if no model emitted a vocalization.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Intent.MergedIntent.VocalizationUrgency
member.summary: Urgency of the winning vocalization [0.0 - 1.0].

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Intent.MergedIntent.Trace
member.summary: Debug trace showing which model contributed to each channel. Only available in DEBUG builds.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Intent.MergedIntent.Empty
member.summary: Empty merged intent (no actions, no movement).

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Intent.MergedIntent.HasAnyIntent
member.summary: Whether this intent has any actionable content.

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Runtime.BehaviorModel
member.summary: A compiled behavior model ready for execution. Contains bytecode, state schema, constant pool, string table, and optional debug info.

remarks.para: Binary format: - Header (32 bytes) - Extension header (24 bytes, optional) - State schema (variable) - Continuation points table (variable, optional) - Constant pool (variable) - String table (variable) - Bytecode (variable) - Debug info (variable, optional)

member.summary: Input/output state schema.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Runtime.BehaviorModel.ContinuationPoints

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Runtime.BehaviorModelInterpreter
member.summary: Lightweight interpreter for compiled ABML behavior models. Designed for per-frame evaluation with zero allocations after initialization.

remarks.para: This interpreter uses a stack-based architecture for simplicity and cache efficiency. All values are stored as doubles to avoid boxing and enable SIMD-friendly operations.
The interpreter is NOT thread-safe. Each character should have its own interpreter instance.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Runtime.BehaviorModelInterpreter.Model
member.summary: The model being interpreted.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Runtime.BehaviorModelInterpreter.ModelId
member.summary: Model ID for identification.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Runtime.BehaviorModelInterpreter.InputSchema
member.summary: Input schema for this model.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Runtime.BehaviorModelInterpreter.StringTable
member.summary: String table for output string lookup.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Runtime.BehaviorModelInterpreter.#ctor(BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Runtime.BehaviorModel)
member.summary: Creates an interpreter for the given behavior model.
member.param: The compiled behavior model to interpret.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Runtime.BehaviorModelInterpreter.SetRandomSeed(System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the random seed for deterministic execution. Call before Evaluate() for reproducible results.
member.param: Random seed (e.g., frame number for replays).

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Runtime.BehaviorModelInterpreter.Evaluate(System.ReadOnlySpan{System.Double},System.Span{System.Double})
member.summary: Evaluates the behavior model with the given input state. Returns the output state (action intent).
member.remarks: This method is allocation-free after initial setup.
member.param: Current game state values (must match input schema).
Pre-allocated output buffer (must match output schema).

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Runtime.BehaviorModelInterpreter.ReadUInt16
member.summary: Reads a 16-bit unsigned integer from bytecode (little-endian).

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Runtime.BehaviorModelInterpreter.CurrentStackDepth
member.summary: Gets the current stack depth (for debugging).

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Runtime.BehaviorModelInterpreter.CurrentInstructionPointer
member.summary: Gets the current instruction pointer (for debugging).

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Runtime.BehaviorModelInterpreter.IsPaused
member.summary: Whether evaluation is currently paused at a continuation point.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Runtime.BehaviorModelInterpreter.PausedContinuationPointIndex
member.summary: Index of the continuation point where evaluation is paused (-1 if not paused).

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Runtime.BehaviorModelInterpreter.EvaluateWithPause(System.ReadOnlySpan{System.Double},System.Span{System.Double})
member.summary: Evaluates the behavior model with continuation point pause support. When a CONTINUATION_POINT opcode is reached, evaluation pauses and returns a result indicating the pause. Call Resume methods to continue.

remarks.para: This method is allocation-free after initial setup, maintaining the same performance characteristics as .
When resuming from a paused state, the instruction pointer continues from where it left off. The stack and locals are preserved across evaluations.

member.param: Current game state values (must match input schema).
Pre-allocated output buffer (must match output schema).
member.returns: Result indicating whether evaluation completed or paused.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Runtime.BehaviorModelInterpreter.ResumeWithDefaultFlow(System.ReadOnlySpan{System.Double},System.Span{System.Double})
member.summary: Resumes evaluation with the default flow after pausing at a continuation point.
member.remarks: Call this when no extension is available or the timeout has expired.
member.returns: Result of continued evaluation.
member.exception: Thrown if not paused at a continuation point.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Runtime.BehaviorModelInterpreter.ResumeWithExtension(BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Runtime.IBehaviorModelInterpreter,System.ReadOnlySpan{System.Double},System.Span{System.Double})
member.summary: Resumes evaluation by executing an extension model instead of the default flow.

remarks.para: The extension interpreter runs to completion, and its output replaces the current output state. After the extension completes, the base model continues from after the continuation point's default flow.

member.exception: Thrown if not paused at a continuation point.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Runtime.BehaviorModelInterpreter.ClearPauseState
member.summary: Clears the pause state without resuming execution.
member.remarks: Use this to abandon a paused evaluation without continuing.

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Runtime.BehaviorModelInterpreterFactory
member.summary: Default factory for creating behavior model interpreters.

remarks.para: This factory creates new BehaviorModelInterpreter instances on demand. Each call creates a fresh interpreter with pre-allocated execution state.
Future enhancements could include: - Interpreter pooling for reduced allocations - Instrumented interpreters for profiling - Debug interpreters with breakpoint support

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Runtime.BehaviorOpcode
member.summary: Stack-based bytecode opcodes for behavior model execution. Different from the register-based expression opcodes in bannou-service.
member.remarks: Instruction encoding: [Opcode:8][Operand1:8][Operand2:8][Operand3:8] Most instructions are 1-2 bytes. Jump targets use 16-bit offsets.

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Runtime.BehaviorOpcode.PushConst
member.summary: Push constant from pool. [PUSH_CONST idx:8]

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Runtime.BehaviorOpcode.PushInput
member.summary: Push input variable value. [PUSH_INPUT idx:8]

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Runtime.BehaviorOpcode.PushLocal
member.summary: Push local variable value. [PUSH_LOCAL idx:8]

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Runtime.BehaviorOpcode.StoreLocal
member.summary: Pop and store to local variable. [STORE_LOCAL idx:8]

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Runtime.BehaviorOpcode.Pop
member.summary: Discard top of stack. [POP]

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Runtime.BehaviorOpcode.Dup
member.summary: Duplicate top of stack. [DUP]

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Runtime.BehaviorOpcode.Swap
member.summary: Swap top two stack values. [SWAP]

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Runtime.BehaviorOpcode.PushString
member.summary: Push string from string table. [PUSH_STRING idx:16]

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Runtime.BehaviorOpcode.Add
member.summary: Pop a, b; push a + b. [ADD]

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Runtime.BehaviorOpcode.Sub
member.summary: Pop a, b; push a - b. [SUB]

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Runtime.BehaviorOpcode.Mul
member.summary: Pop a, b; push a * b. [MUL]

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Runtime.BehaviorOpcode.Div
member.summary: Pop a, b; push a / b. [DIV]

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Runtime.BehaviorOpcode.Mod
member.summary: Pop a, b; push a % b. [MOD]

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Runtime.BehaviorOpcode.Neg
member.summary: Pop a; push -a. [NEG]

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Runtime.BehaviorOpcode.Eq
member.summary: Pop a, b; push 1.0 if a == b, else 0.0. [EQ]

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Runtime.BehaviorOpcode.Ne
member.summary: Pop a, b; push 1.0 if a != b, else 0.0. [NE]

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Runtime.BehaviorOpcode.Lt
member.summary: Pop a, b; push 1.0 if a < b, else 0.0. [LT]

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Runtime.BehaviorOpcode.Le
member.summary: Pop a, b; push 1.0 if a <= b, else 0.0. [LE]

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Runtime.BehaviorOpcode.Gt
member.summary: Pop a, b; push 1.0 if a > b, else 0.0. [GT]

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Runtime.BehaviorOpcode.Ge
member.summary: Pop a, b; push 1.0 if a >= b, else 0.0. [GE]

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Runtime.BehaviorOpcode.And
member.summary: Pop a, b; push 1.0 if both truthy, else 0.0. [AND]

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Runtime.BehaviorOpcode.Or
member.summary: Pop a, b; push 1.0 if either truthy, else 0.0. [OR]

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Runtime.BehaviorOpcode.Not
member.summary: Pop a; push 1.0 if falsy, else 0.0. [NOT]

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Runtime.BehaviorOpcode.Jmp
member.summary: Unconditional jump. [JMP offset:16]

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Runtime.BehaviorOpcode.JmpIf
member.summary: Jump if top of stack is truthy. [JMP_IF offset:16]

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Runtime.BehaviorOpcode.JmpUnless
member.summary: Jump if top of stack is falsy. [JMP_UNLESS offset:16]

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Runtime.BehaviorOpcode.Call
member.summary: Call subroutine. [CALL flow_idx:16]

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Runtime.BehaviorOpcode.Ret
member.summary: Return from subroutine. [RET]

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Runtime.BehaviorOpcode.Halt
member.summary: Stop execution. [HALT]

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Runtime.BehaviorOpcode.SwitchJmp
member.summary: Jump table for switch-like constructs. [SWITCH_JMP cases:8]

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Runtime.BehaviorOpcode.SetOutput
member.summary: Pop value and store in output variable. [SET_OUTPUT idx:8]

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Runtime.BehaviorOpcode.EmitIntent
member.summary: Emit action intent with urgency. [EMIT_INTENT channel:8] Expects stack: [action_string_idx, urgency]

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Runtime.BehaviorOpcode.Rand
member.summary: Push random float [0, 1). [RAND]

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Runtime.BehaviorOpcode.RandInt
member.summary: Push random int in range. [RAND_INT] Stack: [min, max]

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Runtime.BehaviorOpcode.Lerp
member.summary: Linear interpolation. [LERP] Stack: [a, b, t] -> a + (b - a) * t

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Runtime.BehaviorOpcode.Clamp
member.summary: Clamp value to range. [CLAMP] Stack: [value, min, max]

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Runtime.BehaviorOpcode.Abs
member.summary: Absolute value. [ABS] Stack: [a] -> |a|

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Runtime.BehaviorOpcode.Floor
member.summary: Floor. [FLOOR] Stack: [a] -> floor(a)

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Runtime.BehaviorOpcode.Ceil
member.summary: Ceiling. [CEIL] Stack: [a] -> ceil(a)

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Runtime.BehaviorOpcode.Min
member.summary: Minimum of two values. [MIN] Stack: [a, b]

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Runtime.BehaviorOpcode.Max
member.summary: Maximum of two values. [MAX] Stack: [a, b]

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Runtime.BehaviorOpcode.ContinuationPoint
member.summary: Pause for possible extension attachment. [CONTINUATION_POINT cp_idx:16] Interpreter checks for attached extension at this point. If extension available: transfers control to extension flow. If no extension and timeout expires: jumps to default flow.

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Runtime.BehaviorOpcode.ExtensionAvailable
member.summary: Check if extension is available. [EXTENSION_AVAILABLE cp_idx:16] Push 1.0 if extension attached, 0.0 otherwise.

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Runtime.BehaviorOpcode.YieldToExtension
member.summary: Transfer control to attached extension. [YIELD_TO_EXTENSION cp_idx:16] Used internally when extension is attached.

member.summary: Debug breakpoint. [BREAKPOINT]

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Runtime.BehaviorOpcode.Trace
member.summary: Debug trace with string. [TRACE str_idx:16]

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Runtime.BehaviorOpcode.Nop
member.summary: No-operation. [NOP]

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Runtime.CinematicInterpreter
member.summary: Interpreter for cinematic composition using continuation points. Manages streaming extensions and base model coordination.

remarks.para: The CinematicInterpreter wraps a base behavior model and intercepts execution at continuation points. When the base model reaches a continuation point, execution pauses to allow extension injection.
Extensions can be pre-registered or injected dynamically while waiting. If no extension arrives within the timeout, the default flow is executed.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Runtime.CinematicInterpreter.#ctor(BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Runtime.BehaviorModel)
member.summary: Creates a new cinematic interpreter for a base model.

member.summary: Whether execution is waiting at a continuation point.

member.summary: The name of the continuation point currently waiting, if any.

member.summary: The input state array for external modification.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Runtime.CinematicInterpreter.OutputState
member.summary: The output state array for reading results.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Runtime.CinematicInterpreter.RegisterExtension(System.String,BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Runtime.BehaviorModel)
member.summary: Pre-registers an extension model for a continuation point.
member.remarks: Extensions can be registered before or during execution. If registered while waiting at the matching continuation point, the extension will be used in the next Evaluate call.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Runtime.CinematicInterpreter.InjectExtension(System.String,BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Runtime.BehaviorModel)
member.summary: Injects an extension that arrived via streaming.
member.remarks: Use this method when an extension arrives from the network while the interpreter is waiting at a continuation point.
member.returns: True if the extension was accepted (waiting at the matching point).

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Runtime.CinematicInterpreter.RemoveExtension(System.String)
member.summary: Removes an extension from a continuation point.
member.returns: True if the extension was removed.

member.summary: Sets an input value by name.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Runtime.CinematicInterpreter.GetOutput(System.String)
member.summary: Gets an output value by name.
member.returns: The output value, or 0 if not found.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Runtime.CinematicInterpreter.Evaluate
member.summary: Evaluates the current state, handling continuation points with pause support.

remarks.para: This method uses the new EvaluateWithPause mechanism to properly intercept continuation points at the bytecode level. When a continuation point is reached:

list.item: If a pre-registered extension exists, it executes immediately
Otherwise, enters waiting state and returns "waiting" result
On subsequent calls while waiting, checks for timeout or pending extension

member.returns: The evaluation result.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Runtime.CinematicInterpreter.ForceResumeWithDefaultFlow
member.summary: Forces resumption with the default flow, even before timeout.
member.remarks: Use this when you know no extension will arrive and want to continue immediately.
member.returns: True if resumed, false if not waiting.

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Runtime.ContinuationPoint
member.summary: Defines a point in execution where the interpreter pauses for possible extension attachment. Used for streaming composition in cinematics.

remarks.para: Continuation points enable runtime extension of executing behaviors. A game server receives a complete, executable cinematic, starts executing immediately, and can optionally receive extensions that attach to named points.

Execution flow: 1. Interpreter reaches CONTINUATION_POINT opcode 2. Checks if extension is attached at this point 3. If extension available: transfers control to extension 4. If no extension: waits up to timeout, then executes default flow

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Runtime.ContinuationPoint.NameHash
member.summary: FNV-1a hash of the continuation point name for fast lookup.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Runtime.ContinuationPoint.NameStringIndex
member.summary: Index into string table for continuation point name (for debugging).

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Runtime.ContinuationPoint.TimeoutMs
member.summary: Maximum time to wait for extension attachment (milliseconds). If 0, no wait - immediately use default if no extension.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Runtime.ContinuationPoint.DefaultFlowOffset
member.summary: Bytecode offset of the default flow to execute if no extension arrives.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Runtime.ContinuationPoint.BytecodeOffset
member.summary: Bytecode offset where the CONTINUATION_POINT opcode is located.

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Behavior.Runtime.IBehaviorModelInterpreter
member.summary: Interface for behavior model interpreters, enabling DI and testability.

remarks.para: The interpreter executes compiled ABML bytecode against a provided input state. Each character should have its own interpreter instance (not thread-safe).
This interface enables: - Dependency injection in server-side services - Testability through mocking - Future pooling/caching implementations

Pre-allocated output buffer (must match output schema).

member.summary: Evaluates the behavior model with continuation point pause support. When a CONTINUATION_POINT opcode is reached, evaluation pauses and returns a result indicating the pause. Call Resume methods to continue.
member.param: Current game state values (must match input schema).
Pre-allocated output buffer (must match output schema).

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.ResponseCodes
member.summary: Response codes used in the binary WebSocket protocol for success/error indication. These codes are returned in the response header's ResponseCode field.
member.remarks: Codes 0-49 are protocol-level errors (Connect service). Codes 50-69 are service-level errors (downstream service responses). Codes 70+ are shortcut-specific errors.

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.ResponseCodes.OK
member.summary: Request completed successfully.

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.ResponseCodes.RequestError
member.summary: Generic request error (malformed message, invalid format).

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.ResponseCodes.RequestTooLarge
member.summary: Request payload exceeds maximum allowed size.

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.ResponseCodes.TooManyRequests
member.summary: Rate limit exceeded for this client/session.

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.ResponseCodes.InvalidRequestChannel
member.summary: Invalid channel number in request header.

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.ResponseCodes.Unauthorized
member.summary: Authentication required but not provided or invalid.

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.ResponseCodes.ServiceNotFound
member.summary: Target service GUID not found in capability manifest.

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.ResponseCodes.ClientNotFound
member.summary: Target client GUID not found (for client-to-client messages).

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.ResponseCodes.MessageNotFound
member.summary: Referenced message ID not found.

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.ResponseCodes.BroadcastNotAllowed
member.summary: Broadcast not allowed in this connection mode (External mode blocks broadcast).

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.ResponseCodes.Service_BadRequest
member.summary: Service returned 400 Bad Request.

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.ResponseCodes.Service_NotFound
member.summary: Service returned 404 Not Found.

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.ResponseCodes.Service_Unauthorized
member.summary: Service returned 401/403 Unauthorized/Forbidden.

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.ResponseCodes.Service_Conflict
member.summary: Service returned 409 Conflict.

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.ResponseCodes.Service_InternalServerError
member.summary: Service returned 500 Internal Server Error.

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.ResponseCodes.ShortcutExpired
member.summary: Shortcut has expired and is no longer valid.

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.ResponseCodes.ShortcutTargetNotFound
member.summary: Shortcut target endpoint no longer exists.

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.ResponseCodes.ShortcutRevoked
member.summary: Shortcut was explicitly revoked.

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Configuration.BannouJson
member.summary:
Static helper for JSON serialization/deserialization that always uses Bannou's standard configuration. This is the SINGLE SOURCE OF TRUTH for JSON serialization settings across all Bannou services and SDKs.
USE THIS INSTEAD OF JsonSerializer.Deserialize/Serialize DIRECTLY.
This ensures consistent behavior across the codebase: - Case-insensitive property matching (handles both PascalCase and camelCase) - Enums serialize as strings matching C# enum names (e.g., "GettingStarted") - Null values are ignored when writing - Strict number handling (no string-to-number coercion) - Proper handling of all Bannou model types
Example usage: var model = BannouJson.Deserialize<MyModel>(jsonString); var json = BannouJson.Serialize(model);

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Configuration.BannouJson.Options
member.summary: Standard JSON serializer options used throughout Bannou. This is the canonical configuration - all JSON operations should use this.

member.summary: Deserialize JSON string to object using Bannou's standard configuration.

member.summary: Deserialize JSON string to object using Bannou's standard configuration. Throws if result is null.

member.summary: Serialize object to JSON string using Bannou's standard configuration.

member.summary: Serialize object to JSON string using Bannou's standard configuration with explicit type.

member.summary: Deserialize from UTF-8 bytes using Bannou's standard configuration.

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Events.IBannouEvent
member.summary: Base interface for all Bannou events (both service-to-service and client events). All events in the system implement this interface, enabling uniform handling in message taps and event processing pipelines.

remarks.para: This interface defines the minimal contract for all events: - EventId: Unique identifier for deduplication and tracing - Timestamp: When the event was created

member.summary: When the event was created (UTC).

member.summary: The type/name of the event- usually also the topic it's published on.

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Events.BaseServiceEvent
member.summary: Base class for all service-to-service events via RabbitMQ pub/sub. All service events MUST inherit from this class and include these fields.

remarks.para: This class is the single source of truth for base service event properties. It is excluded from NSwag generation (like ApiException) to avoid duplicate definitions. All derived events generated via NSwag will inherit from this class.
Implements IBannouEvent for uniform event handling in message taps.

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Events.PerceptionData
member.summary:
Data representing a perception event for an actor.
Spatial context can be provided in two ways (hybrid approach):
1. Typed: Use the optional spatialContext field for structured spatial data
2. Schema-less: Use perceptionType="spatial" with data containing spatial info
The typed approach is recommended when game server has structured spatial data.
The schema-less approach allows flexibility for game-specific spatial formats.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Events.PerceptionData.PerceptionType
member.summary:
Perception type. Common values: visual, auditory, tactile, olfactory,
proprioceptive, spatial. Use "spatial" for schema-less spatial data in 'data' field.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Events.PerceptionData.SourceId
member.summary: ID of the entity causing this perception

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Events.PerceptionData.SourceType
member.summary: Type of source (character, npc, object, environment)

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Events.PerceptionData.Data
member.summary:
Perception-specific data. For perceptionType="spatial", this can contain
game-specific spatial context in any format the game server defines.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Events.PerceptionData.Urgency
member.summary: How urgent this perception is (0-1)

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Events.PerceptionData.SpatialContext
member.summary:
Optional typed spatial context from game server's local spatial state.
Provides structured information about terrain, nearby objects, hazards, etc.
Alternative to using perceptionType="spatial" with schema-less data.

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Events.SpatialContext
member.summary:
Spatial context derived from game server's authoritative spatial state.
Included in perception events to give NPC actors awareness of their environment
without requiring direct map subscriptions.
Note: additionalProperties=true allows game-specific extensions.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Events.ServiceErrorEvent.MemoryUsage
member.summary: Memory usage percentage (0.0 - 1.0)

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Events.FullServiceMappingsEvent
member.summary:
Published periodically by Orchestrator as the authoritative source of truth
for all service-to-app-id mappings across the entire network.
Consumed by all bannou instances to atomically update their routing tables.
Published every 30 seconds AND immediately when routing changes.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Events.FullServiceMappingsEvent.EventName
member.summary: Fixed event type identifier

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Events.FullServiceMappingsEvent.Mappings
member.summary: Complete dictionary of serviceName -> appId mappings

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Events.FullServiceMappingsEvent.DefaultAppId
member.summary: Default app-id for unmapped services (usually "bannou")

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Events.FullServiceMappingsEvent.Version
member.summary: Monotonically increasing version for ordering. Consumers reject events with version <= current.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Events.FullServiceMappingsEvent.SourceInstanceId
member.summary: Orchestrator instance GUID that published this event

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Events.FullServiceMappingsEvent.TotalServices
member.summary: Total number of services in the mappings dictionary

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Events.SessionConnectedEvent
member.summary:
Published by Connect service when a WebSocket connection is fully established.
This event ensures the RabbitMQ exchange exists before any service publishes
to the session-specific topic (CONNECT_SESSION_{sessionId}).
Permission service uses this to track activeConnections and compile capabilities.
The roles and authorizations enable event-driven capability compilation without
synchronous API calls from Connect to Permission.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Events.SessionConnectedEvent.EventName
member.summary: Fixed event type identifier

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Events.SessionConnectedEvent.SessionId
member.summary: Session ID that just connected via WebSocket

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Events.SessionConnectedEvent.AccountId
member.summary: Account ID owning the session

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Events.SessionConnectedEvent.Roles
member.summary: User roles from JWT (e.g., ["user", "admin"]). Used by Permission to compile capabilities.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Events.SessionConnectedEvent.Authorizations
member.summary: Authorization states from JWT (e.g., ["arcadia:authorized"]). Format is "serviceId:state".

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Events.SessionConnectedEvent.ConnectInstanceId
member.summary: Connect service instance handling this connection (for debugging)

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Events.SessionConnectedEvent.PeerGuid
member.summary:
Unique GUID for peer-to-peer routing. Other connections on the same Connect node
can route messages directly to this connection using this GUID with the Client flag.
Enables zero-copy message forwarding between Game Servers, Actor Pool Nodes, and clients.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Events.SessionConnectedEvent.ClientInfo
member.summary: Optional client metadata (version, platform, etc.)

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Events.SessionDisconnectedEvent
member.summary:
Published by Connect service when a WebSocket connection is closed.
Used by Permission service to remove session from activeConnections.
Also enables cleanup of session-specific resources across services.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Events.SessionDisconnectedEvent.EventName
member.summary: Fixed event type identifier

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Events.SessionDisconnectedEvent.SessionId
member.summary: Session ID that disconnected

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Events.SessionDisconnectedEvent.AccountId
member.summary: Account ID that was disconnected

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Events.SessionDisconnectedEvent.Reason
member.summary: Disconnect reason (logout, timeout, error, server_shutdown)

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Events.SessionDisconnectedEvent.Reconnectable
member.summary: Whether session can reconnect within the reconnection window

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Events.SessionDisconnectedEvent.DurationSeconds
member.summary: How long the session was connected (for metrics)

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Events.SessionReconnectedEvent
member.summary:
Published by Connect service when a WebSocket session is restored after reconnection.
Services should subscribe to this event to re-publish any session shortcuts they
previously granted, as shortcuts are cleared on disconnect and do not persist.
**Session Shortcuts Re-publication:**
Services that publish session shortcuts should listen for this event and re-evaluate
whether the session should receive shortcuts again (e.g., check subscription status,
game state, etc.) and publish new ShortcutPublishedEvents as appropriate.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Events.SessionReconnectedEvent.EventName
member.summary: Fixed event type identifier

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Events.SessionReconnectedEvent.SessionId
member.summary: Session ID that reconnected

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Events.SessionReconnectedEvent.AccountId
member.summary: Account ID owning the reconnected session

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Events.SessionReconnectedEvent.Roles
member.summary: User roles preserved from previous session

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Events.SessionReconnectedEvent.Authorizations
member.summary: Authorization states preserved from previous session

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Events.SessionReconnectedEvent.PreviousDisconnectAt
member.summary: When the previous connection was lost

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Events.SessionReconnectedEvent.PeerGuid
member.summary:
New peer GUID for this reconnected session. Note: This is a NEW GUID -
peer GUIDs do not persist across reconnections. Peers must be notified
of the new GUID to continue peer-to-peer routing.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Events.SessionReconnectedEvent.ReconnectionContext
member.summary: Optional context from the reconnection (client info, etc.)

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Events.CharacterStateUpdateEvent
member.summary:
Published by Actor service when an actor updates a character's behavioral state.
Game servers subscribe to receive state updates for characters they manage.
This is NOT physics data (position, velocity) - that's Game Server territory.
This is intent/emotional/goal state that the character's behavior stack reads as input.
Note: Game servers have no knowledge of actors - they only see character state.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Events.CharacterStateUpdateEvent.EventName
member.summary: Fixed event type identifier

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Events.CharacterStateUpdateEvent.CharacterId
member.summary: Character this update applies to

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Events.CharacterStateUpdateEvent.ActorId
member.summary: Actor that produced this update (opaque to Game Server)

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Events.CharacterStateUpdateEvent.Feelings
member.summary: Emotional state values for the character

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Events.CharacterStateUpdateEvent.Goals
member.summary: Goal state for the character

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Events.CharacterStateUpdateEvent.Memories
member.summary: Memory updates (add/remove/modify)

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Events.CharacterStateUpdateEvent.BehaviorChange
member.summary: Changes to the character's behavior composition

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Events.FeelingState
member.summary:
Emotional state values (0.0 - 1.0 intensity).
The character's behavior stack reads these as inputs to influence decisions.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Events.FeelingState.Angry
member.summary: Anger intensity (0 = calm, 1 = furious)

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Events.FeelingState.Fearful
member.summary: Fear intensity (0 = brave, 1 = terrified)

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Events.FeelingState.Happy
member.summary: Happiness intensity (0 = neutral, 1 = joyful)

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Events.FeelingState.Sad
member.summary: Sadness intensity (0 = content, 1 = devastated)

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Events.FeelingState.Alert
member.summary: Alertness intensity (0 = relaxed, 1 = hypervigilant)

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Events.FeelingState.Custom
member.summary: Additional custom emotional states (game-specific)

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Events.GoalState
member.summary:
Goal state for the character.
Primary goal drives major decisions, secondary goals run in background.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Events.GoalState.PrimaryGoal
member.summary: Current primary goal (e.g., "find_shelter", "confront_enemy")

member.summary: Parameters for the primary goal (e.g., target entity, location)

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Events.GoalState.SecondaryGoals
member.summary: Secondary/background goals

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Events.MemoryUpdate
member.summary:
A single memory update operation (add, remove, or modify).
Memories affect character behavior through recall during cognition.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Events.MemoryUpdate.Operation
member.summary: Memory operation type

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Events.MemoryUpdate.MemoryKey
member.summary: Memory identifier (e.g., "betrayed_by", "friend_of", "witnessed_event")

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Events.MemoryUpdate.MemoryValue
member.summary: Memory value (entity ID, context, intensity, etc.)

member.summary: When this memory expires (if temporary)

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Events.BehaviorCompositionChange
member.summary:
Changes to the character's behavior composition.
RARE - only happens during learning/growth events.
The character's behavior stack is self-sufficient; these changes add new capabilities.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Events.BehaviorCompositionChange.Added
member.summary: Behavior IDs added to composition (e.g., learned skills)

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Events.BehaviorCompositionChange.Removed
member.summary: Behavior IDs removed from composition

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Events.BehaviorCompositionChange.Reason
member.summary: Why this change happened (for debugging/logging)

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.ClientEvents.BaseClientEvent
member.summary: Base class for all server-to-client push events delivered via WebSocket. All client events MUST inherit from this class and include these fields. The eventName field is used for whitelist validation in Connect service.

remarks.para: This class is the single source of truth for base client event properties. It is excluded from NSwag generation (like ApiException) to avoid duplicate definitions. All derived events generated via NSwag will inherit from this class.
Implements IBannouEvent for uniform event handling in message taps.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.ClientEvents.BaseClientEvent.EventName
P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.ClientEvents.BaseClientEvent.EventId
member.summary: Unique identifier for this event instance. Used for deduplication, tracing, and correlation.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.ClientEvents.BaseClientEvent.Timestamp
member.summary: When the event was generated (ISO 8601 format, UTC).

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.ClientEvents.CapabilityManifestEvent
member.summary:
Sent to client when their available API capabilities change.
Contains the complete list of service GUIDs the client can access.
Delivered on initial connection and when permissions change.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.ClientEvents.CapabilityManifestEvent.EventName
member.summary: Fixed event type identifier

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.ClientEvents.CapabilityManifestEvent.SessionId
member.summary: Session ID this manifest applies to

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.ClientEvents.CapabilityManifestEvent.AvailableApis
member.summary: List of available API endpoints with their GUIDs

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.ClientEvents.CapabilityManifestEvent.Version
member.summary: Manifest version number (incremented on each change)

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.ClientEvents.CapabilityManifestEvent.Reason
member.summary: Reason for manifest update (e.g., "initial_connection", "capabilities_updated", "role_changed")

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.ClientEvents.CapabilityManifestEvent.PeerGuid
member.summary:
Unique GUID for peer-to-peer routing on this Connect node.
Other connections on the same Connect node can route messages directly
to this connection using this GUID with the Client flag (0x20).
Enables zero-copy message forwarding between Game Servers, Actor Pool Nodes, and clients.
Note: Only valid while connected to the same Connect instance.

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.ClientEvents.ClientCapabilityEntry
member.summary: Individual API capability entry with routing information

member.summary: Client-salted GUID for this endpoint (unique per client)

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.ClientEvents.ClientCapabilityEntry.ServiceName
member.summary: Service name (e.g., "account", "game-session")

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.ClientEvents.ClientCapabilityEntry.Method

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.ClientEvents.ClientCapabilityEntry.EndpointKey
member.summary: Full endpoint key for routing (e.g., "account:POST:/account/get")

member.summary:
Sent to client before WebSocket connection is closed.
If reconnectable, includes a token for session restoration.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.ClientEvents.DisconnectNotificationEvent.EventName
member.summary: Fixed event type identifier

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.ClientEvents.DisconnectNotificationEvent.ReconnectionToken
member.summary: Token for reconnecting to the same session (valid for 5 minutes)

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.ClientEvents.DisconnectNotificationEvent.ExpiresAt
member.summary: When the reconnection token expires

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.ClientEvents.DisconnectNotificationEvent.Reconnectable
member.summary: Whether this session can be reconnected

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.ClientEvents.DisconnectNotificationEvent.Reason
member.summary:
Reason for disconnection:
- graceful_disconnect: Client-initiated or idle timeout
- session_invalidated: Session was revoked (e.g., logout, account deleted)
- server_shutdown: Server is shutting down gracefully
- forced_disconnect: Administrative disconnection

member.summary:
Generic error notification sent to client.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.ClientEvents.SystemErrorEvent.EventName

member.summary: Human-readable error message

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.ClientEvents.SystemErrorEvent.Details
member.summary: Additional error details (service-specific)

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.ClientEvents.SystemErrorEvent.Recoverable
member.summary: Whether the client can retry the operation

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.ClientEvents.SessionCapabilitiesEvent
member.summary:
Internal event carrying compiled capabilities from Permission to Connect.
NOT forwarded to clients - Connect intercepts, generates client-salted GUIDs,
and sends CapabilityManifestEvent to the client.

member.summary: Fixed event type identifier (internal, not forwarded to client)

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.ClientEvents.SessionCapabilitiesEvent.Reason
member.summary: Why capabilities were sent (e.g., "session_connected", "service_registered", "role_changed")

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.ClientEvents.SystemNotificationEvent
member.summary:
Generic notification event for system-level messages.
Used for announcements, maintenance notices, etc.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.ClientEvents.SystemNotificationEvent.EventName
member.summary: Fixed event type identifier

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.ClientEvents.SystemNotificationEvent.NotificationType
member.summary: Type of notification

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.ClientEvents.SystemNotificationEvent.Message
member.summary: Human-readable notification message

member.summary: Optional URL for more information

member.summary: When this notification expires/becomes irrelevant

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.ClientEvents.ShortcutPublishedEvent
member.summary:
Published by services to create or update a session shortcut.
Sent to CONNECT_SESSION_{sessionId} topic for the specific session.
Connect handles this event internally and does NOT forward to the client.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.ClientEvents.ShortcutPublishedEvent.EventName
member.summary: Fixed event type identifier.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.ClientEvents.ShortcutPublishedEvent.SessionId
member.summary: Target session for this shortcut.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.ClientEvents.ShortcutPublishedEvent.Shortcut
member.summary: The session shortcut definition containing the pre-bound payload and routing information.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.ClientEvents.ShortcutPublishedEvent.ReplaceExisting
member.summary:
If true and a shortcut with the same routeGuid exists, replace it.
If false and shortcut exists, the event is ignored.

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.ClientEvents.ShortcutRevokedEvent
member.summary:
Published by services to remove shortcuts.
Sent to CONNECT_SESSION_{sessionId} topic for the specific session.
Supports both single-shortcut revocation (by routeGuid) and
bulk revocation (all shortcuts from a sourceService).

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.ClientEvents.ShortcutRevokedEvent.EventName
member.summary: Fixed event type identifier.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.ClientEvents.ShortcutRevokedEvent.SessionId
member.summary: Target session for revocation.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.ClientEvents.ShortcutRevokedEvent.RouteGuid
member.summary:
Specific shortcut to revoke.
If provided, only this shortcut is removed.
Mutually exclusive with revokeByService.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.ClientEvents.ShortcutRevokedEvent.RevokeByService
member.summary:
Revoke ALL shortcuts from this source service.
Used when a service needs to clear all its shortcuts.
Mutually exclusive with routeGuid.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.ClientEvents.ShortcutRevokedEvent.Reason
member.summary: Optional reason for revocation (for logging/debugging).

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.ClientEvents.SessionShortcut
member.summary:
A pre-bound API call that clients can invoke with a single GUID.
The boundPayload is injected by Connect when the shortcut is invoked.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.ClientEvents.SessionShortcut.RouteGuid
member.summary:
Client-salted GUID for invoking this shortcut.
Uses UUID version 7 bits to distinguish from service GUIDs (version 5).

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.ClientEvents.SessionShortcut.TargetGuid
member.summary:
The actual service capability GUID this shortcut invokes.
Must be a valid capability in the client's current capability manifest.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.ClientEvents.SessionShortcut.BoundPayload
member.summary:
Pre-serialized JSON payload passed unchanged to the target service.
Connect treats this as opaque bytes - no deserialization or modification.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.ClientEvents.SessionShortcut.Metadata
member.summary: Metadata about the shortcut including display name, source service, and lifecycle information.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.ClientEvents.SessionShortcutMetadata.Description
member.summary: Human-readable description of what this shortcut does.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.ClientEvents.SessionShortcutMetadata.TargetService

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.ClientEvents.SessionShortcutMetadata.TargetMethod

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.ClientEvents.SessionShortcutMetadata.TargetEndpoint
member.summary: The target endpoint for routing.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.ClientEvents.SessionShortcutMetadata.CreatedAt

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.ClientEvents.SessionShortcutMetadata.Tags
member.summary: Optional categorization tags for client-side organization.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.ClientEvents.SessionShortcutMetadata.DisplayName
member.summary: Optional user-friendly name for display in client UIs.

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Connect.Protocol.BinaryMessage
member.summary: Represents a complete binary message in the Bannou WebSocket protocol. Request messages use a 31-byte header, response messages use a 16-byte header. Provides zero-copy parsing and serialization for optimal performance.

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Connect.Protocol.BinaryMessage.HeaderSize
member.summary: Size of the binary header in bytes for request messages.

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Connect.Protocol.BinaryMessage.ResponseHeaderSize
member.summary: Size of the binary header in bytes for response messages. Response headers are smaller because ServiceGuid is not needed (client correlates via MessageId).

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Connect.Protocol.BinaryMessage.Flags
member.summary: Message behavior flags

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Connect.Protocol.BinaryMessage.Channel
member.summary: Channel for sequential message processing (0-65535, 0 = default)

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Connect.Protocol.BinaryMessage.SequenceNumber
member.summary: Per-channel sequence number for message ordering

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Connect.Protocol.BinaryMessage.ServiceGuid
member.summary: Client-salted service GUID for routing (only used in request messages). For response messages, this is Guid.Empty since routing is not needed.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Connect.Protocol.BinaryMessage.MessageId
member.summary: Unique message ID for request/response correlation

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Connect.Protocol.BinaryMessage.ResponseCode
member.summary: Response code for response messages (0 = OK, non-zero = error). Only meaningful when Flags has Response set.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Connect.Protocol.BinaryMessage.Payload
member.summary: Message payload (JSON or binary data based on flags). For error responses (non-zero ResponseCode), this is empty.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Connect.Protocol.BinaryMessage.#ctor(BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Connect.Protocol.MessageFlags,System.UInt16,System.UInt32,System.Guid,System.UInt64,System.ReadOnlyMemory{System.Byte})
member.summary: Initializes a new binary message with the specified parameters (for requests).

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Connect.Protocol.BinaryMessage.#ctor(BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Connect.Protocol.MessageFlags,System.UInt16,System.UInt32,System.UInt64,System.Byte,System.ReadOnlyMemory{System.Byte})
member.summary: Initializes a new binary message with the specified parameters (for responses).

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Connect.Protocol.BinaryMessage.FromJson(System.UInt16,System.UInt32,System.Guid,System.UInt64,System.String,BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Connect.Protocol.MessageFlags)
member.summary: Creates a binary message from a JSON string payload.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Connect.Protocol.BinaryMessage.FromBinary(System.UInt16,System.UInt32,System.Guid,System.UInt64,System.ReadOnlyMemory{System.Byte},BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Connect.Protocol.MessageFlags)
member.summary: Creates a binary message from raw binary payload.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Connect.Protocol.BinaryMessage.CreateResponse(BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Connect.Protocol.BinaryMessage,BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Connect.ResponseCodes,System.ReadOnlyMemory{System.Byte})
member.summary: Creates a response message for the given request. For error responses (non-zero responseCode), the payload should be empty. For success responses (responseCode = 0), the payload contains the response data.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.BannouService.Connect.Protocol.BinaryMessage.GetJsonPayload
member.summary: Gets the JSON payload as a string (if the message is JSON).
